thread.title: Get your tickets to the Laramie Ghost Tour before they disappear
thread.title_full: Get your tickets to the Laramie Ghost Tour before they disappear

title: Get your tickets to the Laramie Ghost Tour before they disappear
text: Legal Information Get your tickets to the Laramie Ghost Tour before they disappear Lynette Nelson originally came up with the idea to start the Ghost Tours of Laramie City while researching the town's history."Laramie was a Wild West town like Cheyenne," she said. "There was no law, and people were just doing what they wanted."Nelson said since she lived in Laramie for 20 years when she began doing this research and had no idea Laramie had a sordid past, she thought it was time to bring the knowledge to the masses.Sixteen years later, Nelson said the tour has sold out every year."It's hard to get on the tours since it sells out," she said. "It's been really popular."She said she feels the tours have been so popular over the years because she and the staff take it beyond the typical haunted house."We don't have the chainsaw guy that chases you because we take you through and capture your imagination," she said. "We bring the past to life. We tell true documented stories of the past."The hour-and-a-half tours take visitors through the horse barn at the Wyoming Territorial Prison, which Nelson said helps set the mood. Then visitors go on a hayride through historic downtown Laramie, coming back to be led through a candlelight tour of the prison.Throughout the tour, there are re-enactors to bring the stories to life. Nelson said many stories are drawn from Laramie history, but some come from other Wyoming towns.Tour groups contain 25 to 30 people and start every half-hour, bringing the total to six tours a night."Truth is scarier than fiction," Nelson said. "You get to participate in it." If you go What: A spooky tour of various locations in Laramie, with a history lesson thrown in. When: Oct. 23-24, 29-31, every half-hour from 7-9:30 p.m. Where: Wyoming Territorial Prison, 975 Snowy Range Road, Laramie Cost: $10 for 12 and under; $15 per adult Published on: Wednesday, Oct 21, 2015 - 09:41:12 am MDT Ellen Fike
